triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core AI systems studied in this paper for their ability to develop social conventions.

triples.name: Convention (norm)
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates the spontaneous emergence of social conventions in decentralized LLM populations, a novel finding.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: AI agents are the fundamental entities that communicate and develop social conventions in the paper's experimental framework.

triples.name: Collective behavior
triples.relevance: The paper shows how collective biases emerge in agent populations even when individual agents are unbiased, revealing new properties of collective systems.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper studies decentralized populations of agents as a multi-agent system framework for emergent social coordination.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: Agents communicate through natural language, which is fundamental to the emergence of social conventions in the paper's study.
